channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: EVACUATION ORDER; 09:15AM; MAP: https://lafd.maps.arcgis.com/apps/Media/index.html?appid=ba8cfed4b4a04d49b7489eb8300727a8; #ShadowHills; EVACUATE NOW due to the high risk of debris flow triggered by heavy rain from the storm impacting the area today through Tuesday. The EVACUATION ORDER is for the La Tuna Canyon Road area, with borders of Horse Haven Street to the North, Martindale Avenue to the East, Penrose Street to the South, Ledge Avenue to the West. Evacuation Centers for people and household pets have opened at Sunland Senior Citizen Center (8640 Fenwick St, Sunland, CA 91040) and Lake View Terrace Recreation Center (11075 Foothill Blvd, Lake View Terrace, CA 91342). Large animals can be evacuated to Hansen Dam Horse Park (11127 Orcas Ave. Lake View Terrace, CA 91342) and the LA Equestrian Center (480 Riverside Dr, Burbank, CA 91506). Check lafd.org/alerts for updates on this evacuation order. Debris flows can bring water, mud, boulders, and other debris that can cover cars and houses. Pack all people and pets into your vehicle and leave the area immediately. More information, including a map, can be found at www.lafd.org/news EVACUEN AHORA debido al flujo de escombros de alto riesgo provocado por las fuertes lluvias de la tormenta que impactaran el área desde hoy hasta el martes. La ORDEN DE EVACUACIÓN es para el área La Tuna Canyon Road, con límites de Horse Haven St. al norte, Martindale Ave. al este, Penrose St al sur, Ledge Ave al oeste. Se han abierto refugios para personas y mascotas domésticas en Sunland Senior Citizen Center (8640 Fenwick St, Sunland, CA 91040) y Lake View Terrace Recreation Center (11075 Foothill Blvd, Lake View Terrace, CA 91342). Los animales grandes pueden ser evacuados al Hansen Dam Horse Park (11127 Orcas Ave. Lake View Terrace, CA 91342) y al LA Equestrian Center (480 Riverside Dr, Burbank, CA 91506). Visite lafd.org/alerts para obtener actualizaciones sobre esta orden de evacuación. Los flujos de escombros pueden traer agua, lodo, rocas y otros escombros que pueden cubrir automóviles y casas. Empaque a todas las personas y mascotas en su vehículo y abandone el área inmediatamente. Puede encontrar más información, incluido un mapa, en www.lafd.org/news; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/03/2024 INC#1609

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1609; 11:51PM; 7255 N Clybourn Av; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/ayaoto8T2gajhhQu9; #SunValley; It took 78 firefighters 61 minutes operating in defensive mode to extinguish the blaze consuming the 80' x 120' one-story commercial structure. One man from the scene was transported to a local hospital with a medical complaint (not directly related to smoke or fire). LAFD Heavy Equipment and RS3 (remote firefighting vehicle) will be performing an extended operation to ensure all the hot spots and smoldering debris are uncovered for extinguishment. No firefighter injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AR1 BC11 BC12 BC14 BC5 CM40 CM42 E102 E227 E239 E260 E27 E278 E289 E298 E60 E75 E77 E86 E87 E89 EA1 EM14 EM5 HE1 HR3 PI3 RA77 RA86 RA889 RA89 RS3 SO1 SQ87 T27 T39 T60 T78 T89 T98 UR27 UR88; CH8; 12 13 15; Nicholas Prange

EVACUATION WARNING; 10:00PM; MAP: https://www.lafd.org/news/strong-february-rain-storm-hits-los-angeles-area; #ShadowHills; LAFD: A strong storm coming Sunday-Tuesday may trigger a life-threatening debris flow. EVACUATION WARNING: La Tuna Canyon Road starting at Martindale to the east, Primrose to the south, Ledge to the west, Horse Haven to the north should prepare to evacuate. This will likely be upgraded to an evacuation order at 8am Sunday. Check lafd.org/alerts for updates. LAFD: Una fuerte tormenta que comience el domingo hasta martes puede provocar flujos de escombros que pongan en peligro la vida. ADVERTENCIA DE EVACUACIÓN: La Tuna Canyon Rd. comenzando en Martindale al este, Primrose al sur, Ledge al oeste y Horse Haven al norte deben prepararse para evacuar. Es probable que esto se actualice a una orden de evacuación a las 8 a.m. del domingo. Consulte lafd.org/alerts para obtener actualizaciones.; Nicholas Prange

Update Confined Space Rescue; INC#1224; 09:30PM; EB 118 Fwy x Laurel Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/eaWHf1fGHVqxpoR37; #Pacoima; Rescuers thoroughly searched the tunnels/drains/channels and did not locate an injured female, as reported. One adult male was located, but did not wish to receive LAFD assistance in any way. Crews will be picking up the equipment and clearing the scene shortly.; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E18 E27 E275 E288 E289 E298 E75 E87 E88 E89 EM15 HR3 PI3 RA70 RA75 RA96 SO1 SQ87 T75 T88 T89 T98 UR88 UR89; CH8; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Confined Space Rescue; INC#1224; 06:14PM; EB 118 Fwy x Laurel Canyon Blvd; #Pacoima; One adult female is trapped in a storm drain with unknown injuries. Urban Search and Rescue teams are responding to make entry into the confined space.; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E18 E27 E275 E288 E289 E75 E87 E88 EM15 HR3 RA70 RA75 RA96 SO1 SQ87 T75 T88 T89 UR88 UR89; CH8; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0930; 02:43PM; 7230 N Medical Center Dr; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/fiAWHCXYzmFZyx2z9; #WestHills; Firefighters found a small fire on the fourth floor of a medical center building, held in check by a fire sprinkler. Forty-six firefighters responded to the modern sealed six-story building and took 26 minutes to access and extinguish the flames, which were well-contained by the sprinklers. Firefighters will be on scene for an extended operation to clear the building of water and smoke. resulting from the fire and sprinklers. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E106 E273 E296 E305 E72 E84 EM17 RA106 RA72 RA84 SO1 T105 T73 T96; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0930; 02:43PM; 7230 N Medical Center Dr; #WestHills; Six-story medical center building with fire showing from the fourth floor. Reports of fire sprinkler activations on that floor. Offensive mode.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E106 E296 E305 E72 E84 RA106 RA72 SO1 T105 T96; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0596; 11:23AM; 4418 N Homer St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/xUY9GqhQjsH27xR18; #MontecitoHeights; Firefighters responded to a one-story home with heavy fire in the attic, and some extension into the living space below. Crews advanced hose lines through crowded rooms with excessive storage to gain access to the fire from below. Additional firefighters ascended ladders to the roof to cut holes for ventilation, and made great progress to extinguish flames with hose lines from above (spraying hose lines down through the holes they made). Ultimately, it took 32 firefighters 20 minutes to eliminate the fire. One occupant escaped in good health. Paramedics provided a medical evaluation as a precaution, but the occupant chose not to accept ambulance transport to the hospital. No further injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E12 E201 E212 E44 RA1 RA12 RA801 SC1 SO1 SQ21 T1 T12; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange
